title: Introducing: Ava Marie
content:
I’m not quite sure why it is that the most emotional songs tend to be the product of solo ventures.

Maybe it’s the deeply personal connection that the one individual has with the music, as opposed to being spread thinly across the members of the band. Ava Marie is a fitting testimony to this belief, the solo outfit of an as yet unnamed Maine musician, with his three debut tracks demonstrating an expert ability to compose stirringly moving acoustic numbers.

Taking inspiration from the likes of Nick Drake and Bright Eyes, Ava Marie maintains a minimal, sparse atmosphere in each track, whilst letting his subtle vocals and honest lyrics  tear at your heartstrings. A Calm, A Statuette, A Streetlamp At 9.27 is potentially the strongest of the trio, retelling the story of lost love and thoughts once forgotten, before collapsing into a Conor Oberst-esque pit of destruction and self-loathing.
